long: Meaning: to "slacken" (in many applications, literal or figurative).  Usage: abate, cease, consume, draw (toward evening), fail, (be) faint, be (wax) feeble, forsake, idle, leave, let alone (go, down), (be) slack, stay, be still, be slothful, (be) weak(-en). See "H7495".  Source: a primitive root;
